title: Jeff Daniels to star as former FBI Director James Comey in CBS miniseries based on A Higher Loyalty
text:
He's a respected star of stage and screen and has two Emmys to his name.

And now Jeff Daniels has landed another meaty role as former FBI Director James Comey in a CBS miniseries based on Comey's bestseller A Higher Loyalty: Truth, Lies and Leadership.

The actor, 64, will star opposite Brendan Gleeson who has been tapped to play Donald Trump in the four-hour television event.

Meaty role: Jeff Daniels, left, will star as former FBI Director James Comey, right, in a CBS miniseries based on Comey's bestseller A Higher Loyalty: Truth, Lies and Leadership

Veteran screenwriter Bill Ray (Captain Phillips, The Hunger Games, State Of Play, Breach) has adapted the book for the small screen and will also direct the series.

Production is set to begin next month.

Comey was fired by Trump in May 2017 after Trump took objection to the way the FBI veteran had handled the investigation into his political opponent Hilary Clinton's emails.

Comey learned about his termination via the media while in the middle of a speech to FBI agents in Los Angeles.

Respected actor: Most recently, Daniels starred in the Hulu original series The Looming Tower, about the rivalry between the FBI and the CIA in the run-up to the 9/11 terror attacks

Star of stage and screen: This past year, the actor, 64, earned his third Tony nomination for his role as Atticus Finch in Aaron Sorkin's adaptation of To Kill A Mockingbird on Broadway

Speaking about casting Daniels in the lead role, Ray described the star as 'so perfect for this part'

'We talked backstage after I saw him in 'To Kill a Mockingbird' on Broadway, and I knew I was looking at the only person who could play Jim Comey. Lucky for me, he said yes,' Ray said.

As for Irish actor Gleeson, 64, Ray acknowledges that playing Trump is a challenge but says Gleeson, who nailed Winston Churchill in 2009's Into the Storm, is up to the task.

'You have to have presence, and a singular kind of dynamism. You also have to have the courage and the will to play Trump’s psychology from the inside out. Oh, and you have to be spectacularly talented and watchable. Not many actors check all those boxes. Brendan does,' Ray explained.

Challenge: Irish actor Brendan Gleeson, 64, has been tapped to play Donald Trump in the four-hour television event that starts production next month

Has the chops: Gleeson isn't afraid of taking on larger than life historical characters; he starred as Winston Churchill in the 2009 HBO movie Into The Storm

Gleeson's credits also include the Harry Potter films, Gangs Of New York, In Bruges, Edge Of tomorrow, Live By Night and Paddington 2.

Most recently, Daniels starred on the small screen in the Hulu original series The Looming Tower, about the rivalry between the FBI and the CIA in the run-up to the 9/11 terror attacks.

His credits also include The Newsroom, Godless, The Martian and, of course, 1994's Dumb And Dumber.

This past year, he starred on Broadway as Atticus Finch in Aaron Sorkin's adaptation of Harper Lee's To Kill A Mockingbird for which he earned his third Tony nomination.

Calling the shots: Veteran screenwriter Bill Ray (Captain Phillips, The Hunger Games, State Of Play, Breach) has adapted Comey's book for the small screen and will also direct the miniseries
